poem:
Title: "Inhale of Hope"

Midland's air once heavy, now dances light,
Often hidden truths beam in morning's light.
Round two-thousand undying suns rise higher,
By clear breath's blessing above the mire.
Asthma retreats, hearts unhindered beat,
Lungs grow stronger, no longer retreat.
Imagining strokes, simply a brush of life's art,
In cleaner whispers of air, begins each new start.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cleaner air in West Midlands could prevent 2,000 deaths a year, study finds A study has revealed that cleaning up the air in the West Midlands could prevent the early deaths of about 2,000 people a year. If the region were to meet World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines for air pollution, it could also avoid 2,000 new asthma cases, 770 new cases of heart disease, 170 new lung cancers and 650 strokes annually, the study". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
